page.title: 15 BUILDING AGE AND MATERIALS
page.content: Most of the houses in the area(Exning) are made of brick(mainly red and white), with a few yellow bricked houses as well.The light coloured bricks were made in Burwell and were therefore cheap .There were no stone houses,this is because stone is not abundant in this area.There is little use of concrete.The combination of wood and brick is a modern style,though not many houses have it.It only appeared on Studlands Park,the new housing estate in Newmarket.During World War 2 there weren't many houses built because the materials were being used for other things. The major development in the last 30 years has been the building of two large housing estates,these have been built on old stud land.They have been named Scaltback Estate and Studlands Park.
